newsitem.title: UK: NWE naphtha off on softer crude, double stem block.
newsitem.headline: NWE naphtha off on softer crude, double stem block.

text.p: NWE naphtha was slightly softer on Wednesday in line with weaker crude prices, traders said.
A pipeline spec cargo for May 5-15 delivery was sold at $179 cif NWE, which compared with bids around the $180-$181 level seen on Tuesday.
Full-range cargoes were assessed some $1-$2 lower than this, or $1 below the May paper. On swaps, May paper was talked around $178/$179, June paper was assessed some 50 cents to $1.0 above.
News that Sonatrach would not be giving permission to load double stem naphtha cargoes out of Skikda for the time being was also expected to weigh on the market.

The Asian arbitrage door is only open for double stem cargoes at the moment, so this decision could result in a number of cargoes originally earmarked for Eastern destinations remaining in the European market, traders said.
"They've been given a fair amount of grief about the decision," said one player. "A lot of people have asked them to revoke the decision so we could well find it's been reversed tomorrow."
